page.title: 08 Farming around Haseley
page.content: We went with Mrs Walker to look at the fields around Haseley.Close to the village we found fields growing wheat, kale and beans.Then we went down Latchford and saw barley,beans and potatoes.The latter were being grown for sale to a potato crisp factory. Nearby we saw some fields with grass in and horses grazing.Other fields were being used for hay and silage making.We carried on to the site of the old hamlet of Latchford and went along the farm track.Most of the fields had corn crops in them but some were grass pasture.In one field tractors were out muck-spreading.We also saw some people out on their horses.We came back to Haseley and looked across towards the motorway from the playing field.We could see a mixture of corn and grass fields.Cows were grazing in the latter. by Jeremy Hitchcox.
